result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 3:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Wesley J Kottke appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeremy M. Simon appeared in court. Defendant had previously advised the Court that he would be privately retaining counsel but no attorney has been retained. Defendant referred to SPD. Defendant must pay $250 deposit by February 15, 2022 then $100 monthly starting March 1, 2022 for court appointed counsel if the defendant is not eligible for SPD. 22TR47- NG plea entered.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Initial appearance on February 1, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation.
Defendant and Atty Blankschein appear via video from the WC Jail.

Case called @ 01:13 PM Defendant Jeremy M. Simon in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Emma K Blankschein.  Dennis J Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be privately retaining counsel. Bond argument by ADA Ryan. No objection by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $3500 Sig Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
